substance_access_scores:subs_10near_medi.short_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access (drive time)
substance_access_scores:subs_10near_medi.long_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
substance_access_scores:subs_10near_medi.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest substance use/behavioral health services facilities
substance_access_scores:subs_10near_medi.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest substance use/behavioral health services facilities. Facility location data were collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
substance_access_scores:subs_10near_medi.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest substance use/behavioral health service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

access_scores_substance:subs_cnt.long_name: Access to substance use/behavioral health  by count
access_scores_substance:subs_cnt.short_description: Count of substance use/behavioral health facilities based on facility locations
access_scores_substance:subs_cnt.long_description: Count of substance use/behavioral health facilities based on facility locations. Location data were collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.
access_scores_substance:subs_cnt.statement: There are {value} substance use facilities in {features.name}.

access_scores_substance:subs_3sfca.short_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access score
access_scores_substance:subs_3sfca.long_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
access_scores_substance:subs_3sfca.short_description: Index of substance use/behavioral health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
access_scores_substance:subs_3sfca.long_description: Substance use/behavioral health services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
access_scores_substance:subs_3sfca.statement: The substance use/behavioral health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.
